docs.lead_paragraph: IF BEALE STREET COULD TALK. By James Baldwin 197 pages. Dial Press. $6.95. "Who ever discovered America deserved to be dragged home, in chains, to die." So says one of the characters in James Baldwin's new novel, "If Beale Street Could Talk," And I say that Mr. Baldwin has already picked that particular bone clean, and it is time he found himself another. There is no color line in cliches.

headline.main: No Color Line in Cliches; Books of The Times Sentimental Love Story Adverbs Stalk Menacingly
